title: Will and Grace's Megan Mullally to miss episodes of final amid 'feud'
text:
Karen Walker is taking a break from the sitcom (Picture: Getty)

Megan Mullally is reportedly going to miss episodes from the final season of Will And Grace following a feud with fellow star Debra Messing.

According to TV Line, Megan’s character Karen Walker will not appear in two episodes of the series as the actress requested a ‘temporary leave of absence’ from filming although the actresses’ departure coincides with rumours of a feud between the Will And Grace cast.

Fans noticed earlier this year that Megan and co-star Debra Messing, who plays Grace Adler, had unfollowed one another on Instagram.

Megan also posted a number of Instagram messages alluding to ending a friendship.

In May she wrote: ‘It’s okay to let go of relationships that aren’t healthy and positive, even with people you’ve known for years and once trusted.

‘Shout out to the people who are happy for your happiness, who feel the excitement when you win, who take joy in your success.’

Karen Walker will miss two episodes of the final season (Picture: NBCU Photo Bank)

The actress wrote in another Instagram message. ‘The people who don’t use your success as ammunition against you.’

Advertisement

Advertisement

Megan has since also unfollowed her fellow co-star Sean Hayes on Instagram.

In August singer Demi Lavato teased fans with a picture of her cameo in the hit sitcom.

The star posted a picture of the set with the caption Will & Grace & Demi.

Fan theories so far about Lovato’s connection to Will include that Jenny could be his long-lost daughter or even a potential surrogate.

But the speculation will have to linger for a while – the episodes aren’t expected to air until mid-2020 as part of the final season of Will And Grace.

Megan Mullally and Debra Messing’s representatives have been contacted for a comment.

description: Will and Grace star Megan Mullally to miss episodes of final season amid Debra Messing feud rumours.
